byline.contributor: Peter Baker reported from Washington, and Jodi Rudoren from Jerusalem.
byline.original: By PETER BAKER and JODI RUDOREN

abstract: Israeli Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu and Pres Obama's first meeting in over a year offers ample reason to forge new rapport as men discuss matters of high priority, but past slights and misunderstandings are likely to leave relationship cool; differing opinions on issues including Palestinian territories, Iran and American-Israeli relationship have contributed to tensions.
lead_paragraph: As Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel arrives at the White House on Monday, he and President Obama have reasons to put the past behind them.

headline.main: Obama and Netanyahu: A Story of Slights and Crossed Signals
headline.print_headline: With U.S. and Israel, It’s Who Slighted Whom

snippet: As Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel arrives at the White House on Monday, he and President Obama have reasons to put the past behind them.
